column1: Alfirin was an Elvish name for the flower Men called simbelmynë (they also used the name uilos for the same flower).
column2: Note 38 The name comes from its habit of growing thickly on the tombs of Men: it was found among the Kings mounds in the Barrowfield of Edoras
column3: and also on the Tomb of Elendil.  Tolkien provided a description of "an immortelle
column4: but not dry and papery: simply a beautiful bell-like flower
